chess

Class Chess

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chess

  • public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
    The chess class is runs the main loop for the game and does the book keeping for who's turn it is, where each of the pieces are, prints out the board when needed and whether the king is in check or checkmate.
    Author:
    Evan Loriot, Joseph Klaszky

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static King blackKing
      pointer to black king
      static Piece[][] board
      Piece array of the current official board for the game
      static boolean check
      true if either king is in check, false otherwise
      static boolean checkmate
      variable true when either king is in checkmate, false otherwise
      static boolean draw
      variable true if player has confirmed a draw initiation, false otherwise
      static boolean drawInitiated
      variable true if one player initiates a draw, false otherwise
      static boolean resign
      variable true if either player has resigned
      static King whiteKing
      pointer to white king
      static java.lang.String winner
      variable containing the winning text to output at the end of the game, either: Black wins or White wins

      A method that returns true if the a king is currently checkmated by the opposite player, that is the king is under attack and no move by any piece can take the king to safty

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • clearEnPassant

        public static void clearEnPassant(java.lang.String color)
        This method ensures you the user can only perform EnPassant when it's legal.
        Parameters:
        color - used so that only one color's flags are flipped

      • turn

        public static boolean turn(java.lang.String move,
                           java.lang.String color)
        Does book keeping for each turn and tells the main method if it can continue to the next turn or if it needs to re-do current turn.
        Parameters:
        move - user input for the move they would like to make
        color - current color
        Returns:
        boolean -- true if the input is valid and main can continue to the next turn, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - -- if the user enters badly formatted input.
        See Also:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • whiteTurn

        public static boolean whiteTurn(java.lang.String move)
        Calls turn() method with proper color.
        Parameters:
        move - user input for the move they would like to make
        Returns:
        boolean -- true if the input is valid and main can continue to the next turn, false otherwise

      • blackTurn

        public static boolean blackTurn(java.lang.String move)
        Calls turn() method with proper color.
        Parameters:
        move - user input for the move they would like to make
        Returns:
        boolean -- true if the input is valid and main can continue to the next turn, false otherwise

      • getPieces

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getPieces(java.lang.String color)
        Get's an arrayList of all remaining pieces left on the board of a certain color.
        Parameters:
        color - used in a check to ensure only that the method is only grabbing pieces of the correct color
        Returns:
        ArrayList(Piece) -- list of all pieces of a certain color

      • isInCheck

        public static boolean isInCheck(Piece[][] board,
                                java.lang.String color)
        A method that returns true if the a king is currently under attack by a piece of a different color by checking all the opposing pieces ability to take the targeted king
        Parameters:
        board - A 2-D array that represents the board
        color - the color of the king to check whether it is in check
        Returns:
        boolean -- true if the king of the color is currently under attack, false otherwise

      • isInCheckmate

        public static boolean isInCheckmate(java.lang.String color)
        A method that returns true if the a king is currently checkmated by the opposite player, that is the king is under attack and no move by any piece can take the king to safty
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the king to check for checkmate on
        Returns:
        boolean -- true if the king is checkmated, false otherwise

      • duplicateBoard

        public static Piece[][] duplicateBoard()
        Makes a copy of the current board, used for checking for possible future configuration to find checkmate
        Returns:
        A 2-D array representing a board

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard()
        Iterates over the entire board and prints to stdout either the piece at a give square or the color of the square

      • initializeGame

        public static void initializeGame()
        Setups up the initial board for the start of the game.

      • getColumn

        public static int getColumn(java.lang.String position)
        Takes the user input for the color and turns it into an int for use for moves and such.
        Parameters:
        position - gotten from user input
        Returns:
        an int representing the column entered by the user

      • getRow

        public static int getRow(java.lang.String position)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an int representing the column entered by the user
